event_title: Accelerated grain price decline in Russia during the past week

entities.name: Russian grain price decline
impacts_on_entity: faster price decrease versus previous week
actions_by_entity: prices of 3rd class wheat fell most in Chernozemye, by 740 rubles to 14,480 rubles per ton
in the south, price drop accelerated to 650 rubles, down to 16,350 rubles per ton
in the center, prices fell by 465 rubles to 14,750 rubles
in Siberia decrease was insignificant
in the Volga region a slight increase was recorded
in the Urals prices recovered by 365 rubles to 14,267 rubles per ton
fourth-class wheat prices fell everywhere, especially in Chernozemye by 560 rubles to 13,170 rubles per ton
on the south, 4th-class wheat fell by 450 rubles to 15,333 rubles
fifth-class wheat prices fell rapidly on the south by 750 rubles to 13,950 rubles
only in the Urals, 5th-class wheat prices increased by 100 rubles to 11,250 rubles
feed barley prices mostly declined, biggest drop was 225 rubles in Volga to 12,550 rubles
food rye prices moved mixedly, biggest drop in Volga by 390 rubles to 11,813 rubles
corn entered new season mostly with declines, biggest fall in South 215 rubles to 16,417 rubles
